citation.article-title: Paenibacillus phoenicis sp. nov., isolated from the Phoenix Lander assembly facility and a subsurface molybdenum mine
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Paenibacillus phoenicis sp. nov.
Paenibacillus phoenicis (phoe′ni.cis. L. gen. n. phoenicis of phoenix, isolated from the surface of the clean room where the recently landed Mars Phoenix spacecraft was assembled).

Vegetative cells are rod-shaped with a diameter of 1 to 1.5 µm and a length of 4 to 6 µm, motile, Gram-positive, produce catalase and form endoendospores which are subterminal in position and have a diameter of 1 to 1.5 µm.
Colonies form after 72 h of growth on TSA at 32 °C, are beige, smooth, glistening, have a diameter of 4 mm, show no pigmentation and possess entire edges.
Grows at 32 °C on TSA (Difco), R2A (Difco) and TYG (5 g tryptone, 3 g yeast extract and 1 g glucose per litre).
Produces oval endospores in MSM medium which are resistant to UV radiation up to 500 J m−2.
Tests for urease, tryptophan deaminase and hydrolysis of gelatin are negative.

Assimilation of the following sole carbon sources is positive: glucose, mannitol, inositol, rhamnose, sorbitol, sucrose, melibiose, amygdalin, l-arabinose, d-arabinose, sucrose, l-arabinose, d-xylose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, N-acetylglucosamine, arbutin, salicin, lactose (bovine), starch, aesculin ferric citrate, glycogen, gentiobiose and trehalose.

Acid was not produced from the following substrates: glycerol, erythritol, l-xylose, d-adonitol, dulcitol, inositol, d-sorbitol, d-tagatose, d-fucose, l-fructose, l-arabitol, potassium 2-ketogluconate, potassium 5-ketogluconate, l-sorbose, d-arabinose and l-rhamnose.
Positive for citrate utilization.
Growth occurs between 21 and 50 °C and at pH 7.0–9.0 (pH 10.0 for strain 3P02SAT).
Optimum growth occurs at 37 °C and at pH 7.0.
Growth occurs in the presence of 5 % NaCl.
Growth is inhibited at 65 °C and in the presence of 10 % NaCl.
The major fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0 and C16 : 0.
Major isoprenoid quinone is MK-7 menaquinone and the cell wall contains meso-diaminopimelic acid.
The DNA G+C content is 51.9 to 52.8 mol%.

The type strain, 3PO2SAT ( = NRRL B-59348T = NBRC 106274T), was isolated from surfaces of the Payload Hazardous Servicing Facility (PHSF) located at the Kennedy Space Center where the Phoenix Lander was assembled.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain, 3PO2SAT, is 52.5 mol%.

The type strain, 3PO2SAT, differs from the other two strains, HM06-03 and HM06-05, by producing β-galactosidase and being positive for the Voges–Proskauer reaction but lacks production of lysine and ornithine decarboxylases.
